conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and use ideal gas properties to find temperature at state B.
The p-V diagram shows a process from state A to B to C with pressure on the vertical axis and volume on the horizontal axis. Path from A to B is horizontal, and from B to C is vertical.
Determine temperature at state B given temperature at state A is 27°C.
Horizontal path from A to B indicates constant pressure at 3 × 10^2 Pa, volume changes from 3 × 10^-3 m³ to 1 × 10^-3 m³.
For an ideal gas, constant pressure implies isothermal process, so temperature at state B is the same as at state A.
